name: Parador de Alarcon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The drive up the the Castle (originally an Arab fortress) is incredible. It stands out of the ledge of the city of Alarcon with commanding views across the valley below it and the plains surrounding it.
reviews.title: Beautiful, historic castle - an enchanting stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We reserved the Young Persons Rate through the Paradores-Spain website, and found it to be a terrific deal.
reviews.title: King for a night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon check in we were welcomed and shown to our room on the 1st floor. It was a lovely corner room with views of the valleys and plains. I was a little nervous because some of the reviews mentioned that there were very few windows, but the room we were in had 2 small windows and one large walk up window - it was not dark or dreary at all. The furnishings fit well with the surroundings and the bathroom was mostly marble. We found the room lovely, clean, and quite comfortable. The rooms are equipped with air conditioning.
reviews.title: An absolute must!

likes.disliked: — The shower which couldn't be adjusted properly

reviews.title: Must Go and See this!
reviews.text: We dined in the restaurant, which as is typical in Spain, opened at 8:30 pm. The restaurant setting is stunning with high ceiling and huge royal light fixtures. The menu was quite varied, the service was fine, the presentation was lovely but the food taste was not to our liking, that being said a few people around us seemed to be enjoying their meals so it's possible it was just us, or the dishes we ordered. Breakfast the following morning (which was included in our rate) was a great assortment of toast, croissants, meats, fruit salad, orange juice, coffee - they also serve eggs, etc. We were pleased with the breakfast food and selection.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a terrific hike that takes approximately 2 hours that will take you down the hillside from the town of Alarcon past the original city walls, up to the plains, down to the river, and back along the riverside opposite the city - it is lovely, easy and highly recommended. The views are very nice and the walk itself feels quite historical - we could almost here the hooves of the Knight's horse coming down the trail behind us!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and location

likes.disliked: — no internet access, so-so service at bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my wife were both very impressed with this castle! It was very romantic and clean. Service was great, everyone is friendly. The village, Alarcon, is a very nice village, clean, small, and very very quiet. As you drive up the road to get to Alarcon, you are immediatley in awe as you see the caslte and all its surrounding towers! Its amazing! Restraunt is good, drinks are pretty cheap. Also, try the Cabana restraunt near the Parador. Its good as well. If you are debating about staying here, justbook it! You will be happy with your choice.
reviews.title: Paradise in the form of a Castle!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying in a castle is certainly something you don't do everyday. The rooms were all modernized so you did not really feel like you were in an ancient castle. Seemed like a typical european hotel room from the inside. The bathroom facilities were modern for europe. The shower was open to the room. Nice they had a shower. The beds were fairly hard. The room was rather small. Again, typical for europe where buildings are often older.
reviews.title: Its a castle, not much else to say for it though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't understand how european hotels think that makinge up two twin beds, with two sets of bedding reaching the floow, and then shoving them together, you get a king bed. Not uncommon for europe but not what I look for in quality.
reviews.title: A wonderful romantic getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you were interested in doing anything off the hotel property, there was no information and no one who spoke english or cared to try to communicate. Typical government employees. The food was about what you find in government run Paradores. Better than US National Park food but then what isn't. The food was good but not great. The breakfast was expensive and not worth the price.
reviews.title: Well worth visiting
Fantastic!! Do whatever you can to stay here!
reviews.text: In general, not a bad place to stay. Its really only memorable because of its exterior looks and the view on the drive up.
Fantastic castle in the middle of nowhere, excellent for a weekend out.
reviews.title: Parador of Alarcon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, and you may call me pecky - but for 288€ a night i think i am entitled - the room that i was given had no windows so that i could not enjoy the outside ... eventhough some others had, which makes little sense as the price was the same?? Moreover the room on the 6th floor was the only one with access to the main tower view - again something i did not know ... And for the same price??
reviews.title: Castles in Spain

reviews.text: Finally, a suggestion for te Paradores - please take better advantage of the rooms, with more colourful and medieval flavour.
reviews.title: Real treat on way home from Madrid to Alicante

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Parador is an 8th century fortress. We stayed in a room in the tower (103) that had 3 steps down to a window overloking the courtyard. Canopied 4-poster bed, very modern bathroom. Staff is exceptionally friendly. Breakfast is served at table. Everything is brought to your table as if it were a buffet. Ambiance is exceptional.
reviews.title: Amazing Castle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Small town of about 400 residents. Many cats! Casa Julian directly in front of the parador is an excellent place to dine. Great Pasta Bolognesa! Eat with the locals - culture galore. Walk through the town doesn't take long. Hang out in the lounge at the parador, read the paper, play cards, glass of wine and relax.
reviews.title: An oasis of tranquility in the splendor of an ancient castle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the second Parador on our trip and the most disappointing. It's a spectacular building in a wonderful position but we found it sadly lacking in "something". It was also by almost 60% the dearest. Our room was great, a lovely comfortable 4 poster bed, not in the tower (these cost even more) but to the side with small windows looking out over the gorge. The bathroom was also very good, large and well lit. There were few guests the night we stayed which might have added to the lack of atmosphere (admittedly, November is almost certainly not the best month to experience this hotel) but the main disappointment was the food. The evening meal was poor (our first choice was unavailable) and the breakfast had to be ordered from a menu, then served,so nothing like the choice in other hotels. The Spanish omelette was so salty we couldn't eat it. To sum up, if you want to stay in a castle try it for one night but there are better experiences around.
reviews.title: Not enjoyed as much as we'd anticipated

reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at this parador, as part of a one month tour of Spain by car. Arriving via the N111 and the CU-V-8033 roads we stopped at a mirdor overlooking the two gorges that surround the village of Alarcon. The parador looked magnificent. It was originally a Moorish Castle, enlarged and fortified after the reconquest. The setting is perfect and the village a delight to stroll around. There are a number of bars and restaurants but our favourite was Cabana de Alarcon, for the enthusiasm and humour of the patron, the ambiance, setting and food. A 5 Star experience. We enjoyed several walks around the local countryside, ranging from 2 miles to 5 miles. It is also very well placed for the Don Quixote Trail and the Camino de Santiago. The service at the parador was excellent, as was the breakfast and dinner in a vaulted Grand Hall. The courtyard cafe was ideal, having tables both in and out of the sun. My only criticism was that the rooms were a little on the small side for two people and rather cluttered. Clearly they were fashioned by a designer but not by a user. That said, the views from the window were spectacular and the beds comfortable. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel
reviews.title: Remotely Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This castle turned B&B provided comfortable accommodation in a spectacularly rugged landscape. We had a rest night there on our way from Madrid to the Costa Blanca. The room was a reasonable size with an airy bathroom with double sinks, shower over bath and toilet in a room off this. The bed was a disappointment as despite our reservation for a double room we had 2 single beds pushed together, this is not satisfactory. The room was clean and well maintained with the exception of the bathroom stool which was cracked and could have caused injury. A sumptuous breakfast was served in the ground floor dining room. The lift was useful for transporting heavy luggage up to higher levels. Overall the rate was kinda high (see my hint below) however this castle is an amazing place to stay.
reviews.title: Castle stay with mod cons in a remote area

reviews.text: A beautiful setting for this magnificent parador. I went there at the end of June with a friend en route from Portugal to France. Worth the detour but an expensive night. Certainly worth the detour but not if you are on a tight budget.
reviews.title: A memorable experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A fresh, cool and modern room in an old castle. Sleeping area a bit small, but due to the layout of the large bathroom, the room feels spacious. Windows are small, it's a caslte.
reviews.title: Castle in beautifull setting

description: An exceptional witness to the Reconquest, this 8th. castle, perfectly preserved, retains the aura of Arabic influence, with inimitable bedrooms which recreate the most romantic legends. It rises up on a promontory which presides over a fertile bend of the river Júcar. Military motifs from that period dominate the living rooms, impregnated with stone and Castilian wood.
